bugs.title: Starting Chromium-Browser creates a black screen

bugzilla.short_desc: Starting Chromium-Browser creates a black screen

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
When starting the Chromium-Browser on Gnome 3.20 workstation. Chromium opens up with a black empty window. After a few seconds the browser freezes/crashes the whole Gnome Desktop. Forcing to reboot the computer again.


Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):


How reproducible:
Always


Steps to Reproduce:
1. Click on the Chromium-Browser shortcut to start the browser.
2. A blank black window opens up.


Actual results:
Crashes the Gnome 3.20 desktop(unless killing the browser within a few seconds) and opens a black empty window.  


Expected results:
Open browser and go to the webpage that the user requests.


Additional info:


* I avoid this for now with this trick: google-chrome --disable-gpu as per the comment section tip.


* This bug might have been fixed and you might need to upload the fix to the Fedora Distro.
This bug is located at: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=602679

I need more information here:

* What version of chromium are you running?
* What GPU do you have?
* What driver are you using (e.g. are you using a proprietary driver like the NVIDIA driver)?

I do not see this issue on Fedora 24 x86_64, running on Intel GPU with chromium-53.0.2785.143 (or 116).

I need more information here:

Hello,

* What version of chromium are you running?

+ I am running chromium version: 53.0.2785.116 64 bit on an AMD processor.


* What GPU do you have?

+ I have a NV44(NVIDIA Corporation NV44 [GeForce 7100 GS] (rev a1) Nvidia graphics card.


* What driver are you using (e.g. are you using a proprietary driver like the NVIDIA driver)?


+ I'm using the default: Open Source X.Org X11 nouveau video driver version: 1.0.12-4.fc24.

Note: This seems to be related to Nvidia Cards(in my opinion). I'm currently still running Chromium under that setting short term fix from: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=602679.

Okay, first thing, first. Please update to the latest package in testing (https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-d61c4f72da) and see if the black screen still happens. Please test with chromium-browser running from a terminal, and send over any logs it generates.

It looks like it could be this bug:
https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=573615

I think it is highly likely that this issue is NVIDIA specific, could be something anywhere in that driver stack, from the kernel to X. --disable-gpu is a valid workaround for now, but you really need to open this bug with the chromium upstream so that they can troubleshoot it.

I have installed those three testing packages and the same result. It seems that Chrome is a very expensive browser. It requires too much to keep it happy and working. Firefox seems to run on this computer, and on machines even in a worse shape. I'm not sure if that is the issue or not. I give up on the browser for now but may try it again at sometime later(it was my default for a few years).

I have forgotten to add that it would be impossible to get the output in time. That is because the browser crashes the desktop a few seconds into the terminal output.  This is not good for the drive not cleanly unmounting the filesystem every time anyway. If anything changes let me know I'll be watching this bug report.

bugs.title: Chromium Browser - poor response times to input, slow page loading and juddery scrolling

bugzilla.short_desc: Chromium Browser - poor response times to input, slow page loading and juddery scrolling

long_desc.thetext:
Created attachment 1215930
output from top

Description of problem: severe lag to the point that even this bug reporting form is slow to load and respond.


Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 54.0.2840.71-1.fc25


How reproducible: after update from chromium 53 russian fedora build or a clean install of the entire OS (Fedora-MATE_Compiz-Live-x86_64-25-20161031.n.0.iso) with this package added afterwards. Doesn't matter if using marco or compiz.


Steps to Reproduce:
1.clean install or update chromium and dependencies
2.launch the browser
3.try using as normal

Actual results: very slow key input, extremely slow page scroll and loading


Expected results:normal responsive browser


Additional info:brief system info - Gigabyte GA-AM1M-S2H, Athlon 5350, 8GB Corsair Vengeance CML8GX3M2A1600C9 LP Kit (XMP mode), Seagate ST1000DM003, HL-DT-ST DVDRAM GH24NSB

Please let me know if there are any meaningful diagnostics tools I can attach output from to help with this issue. Everything else on the system is responding as expected as per output from top.
I think I know what's happening here. Building a test package in rawhide now.
Hi, disabling debugging has indeed done the trick. I'm running your rawhide build 54.0.2840.71-2 now in F25 and it's working as expected again.
